DOC.brief_summary: Adequate support is required for challenging percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI). The ""Radial Ultra Support (RUS)"technique is a new support technique that provides active support by deep pass of the coronary wire into the heart cavities (left ventricle-LV, right ventricle-RV) or aorta.
DOC.criteria: Subjects singed informed consent form Subjects eligible for percutaneous coronary intervention Age <18 years or >75 years Subject has a platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3 or > 700,000 cells/mm3. Known nonadherence to double antiplatelet therapy (DAPT) LVEF <30% Continuing bleeding Acute coronary syndrome (STelevation Myocardial infarction) Pregnancy
